comments.body: Seems wrong. Filed https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/41492 to track this
doesn't repro in editor, I assume this is from the build still being messed up

looks like all these config files are now in the same compilation, and since we don't recognise `const x = require` as creating a module, they all conflict.

Not sure how this broke; there's only one file in the directory, sitting next to a tsconfig.

This error repros locally, though of course our build may not be that similar to the real build.

@weswigham can you investigate further? I'm not sure what to look at next.
Notably, it works fine in the editor.
Maybe just.config.js is supposed to provide tsconfigs to the build process?
this also works fine in the editor
repros on 3.9 and 4.0 too
I'm beginning to suspect that the tsconfigs are getting ignored, since scripts/tsconfig.json targets ES2018.
known breaking change, right @rbuckton -- value isn't optional anymore?
Yes, this is expected because the `Promise` is untyped: https://github.com/microsoft/fluentui/blob/ea8ab5cbe8d27fec5ea30524a41bd4f2a26acdd6/scripts/gulp/tasks/browserAdapters.ts#L44
repros with 3.9 too
new limits on `TA extends any` I believe, right @weswigham?

`function f<TA extends any, TB extends any>(a: TA, b: TB): boolean;`
:roll_eyes:
repros on 4.0 too
repros on 3.9 and 4.0 too
repros on 3.9

this error is correct as far as I can tell; one CSS wrapper has a precise type and the other only has 'string'.
it does disappear when building with dd6811fbe37f05a2b79427112a919d75a7417176 (from March 2), so office-ui-fabric will have to fix it somehow
this is the other unique error; haven't figured out what is going on here

`object` is no longer assignable to `Record<string, ComponentSlotStyleInput<{}, {}>>` (because the target has an index signature and the source doesn't -- the Record's value type isn't important.)

This is also correct as far as I can tell, but also disappears with the build from March 2.

comments.body: _This test_ IDK why, but this is, like, only probabilisticly tested or something

[This file](https://github.com/OfficeDev/office-ui-fabric-react/blob/master/packages/merge-styles/src/fontFace.test.ts) isn't blinking in and out of existence or anything... I think something is failing to determinedly always load it... If we see this line get added/removed from the baselines again, I'd be concerned. Though it might be a bug in `jest` or `webpack` and not us. :S
